cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northeastward, forecast to cross the Florida Big Bend, move across southeastern Georgia, then emerge just offshore of the Southeast U.S. coast and continue NE into the Atlantic

weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet, FL to South Santee River, SC (includes GA coast around Savannah)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Atlantic coast from Florida through South Carolina and onward toward the Outer Banks as the storm tracks NE
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) possible Monday evening through early Tuesday with gusts higher in squalls
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding possible (around 1–2 ft above normal tides) during high tide cycles
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands capable of 3–5 inches with isolated 8 inch totals over coastal southeast Georgia
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat in rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents
